title: Dropping George Ford is a gamble - but now is the time to go all in
text:
The bombshell. Now is the time to drop it. Now is the moment to be bold. Now is the win-or-go-home match when there are no get-out-of-jail cards left to play.

Eddie Jones has to get this selection right or his tenure will be deemed a failure.

George Ford dropped, Owen Farrell back to fly-half. A simple statement but freighted with significance.

It has shaken things up, caused ripples and the only ruling as to whether it is the right call or not will come at the final whistle at the Oita Stadium on Saturday.

Those are the stakes and this is the reality – a reversion of sorts to the starting line-up that took England through the 2019 Six Nations championship.
